Rust Quickstart

Build type-safe, high-performance web applications with Rust, compiled to WebAssembly. PhilJS brings fine-grained reactivity to Rust developers.

i

Why Rust + PhilJS?

  • Type Safety: Compile-time guarantees across your entire stack
  • Performance: Near-native speed with WASM, zero-cost abstractions
  • Memory Safety: No null pointers, no data races, no garbage collector
  • Full-Stack Rust: Same language for frontend, backend, and shared code

Prerequisites

Terminal
$# Install Rust (if not already installed)
$curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh
$
$# Add WASM target
$rustup target add wasm32-unknown-unknown
$
$# Install cargo-philjs
$cargo install cargo-philjs

Create a New Project

Terminal
$# Create a new full-stack project
$cargo philjs new my-app --template fullstack
$cd my-app
$
$# Or choose a specific template
$cargo philjs new my-app --template minimal
$cargo philjs new my-app --template ssr
$cargo philjs new my-app --template liveview

Project Structure

Project Structuretext
1my-app/
2├── Cargo.toml           # Rust dependencies
3├── src/
4│   ├── lib.rs           # WASM entry point
5│   ├── app.rs           # Root component
6│   └── components/      # UI components
7│       ├── mod.rs
8│       ├── header.rs
9│       └── counter.rs
10├── server/              # (Full-stack only)
11│   ├── main.rs          # Server entry
12│   └── routes/          # API routes
13├── static/              # Static assets
14│   └── styles.css
15└── index.html           # HTML template

Your First Component

First Componentrust
1// src/lib.rs
2use philjs::prelude::*;
3use wasm_bindgen::prelude::*;
4 
5mod components;
6use components::app::App;
7 
8#[wasm_bindgen(start)]
9pub fn main() {
10    // Set up panic handler for better error messages
11    console_error_panic_hook::set_once();
12 
13    // Mount the app to the DOM
14    mount_to_body(App);
15}
16 
17// src/components/app.rs
18use philjs::prelude::*;
19use super::counter::Counter;
20 
21#[component]
22pub fn App() -> impl IntoView {
23    view! {
24        <main class="container">
25            <h1>"Welcome to PhilJS"</h1>
26            <p>"Built with Rust and WebAssembly"</p>
27            <Counter />
28        </main>
29    }
30}
31 
32// src/components/counter.rs
33use philjs::prelude::*;
34 
35#[component]
36pub fn Counter() -> impl IntoView {
37    let (count, set_count) = create_signal(0);
38 
39    view! {
40        <div class="counter">
41            <button on:click=move |_| set_count.update(|n| *n -= 1)>
42                "-"
43            </button>
44            <span class="count">{count}</span>
45            <button on:click=move |_| set_count.update(|n| *n += 1)>
46                "+"
47            </button>
48        </div>
49    }
50}

Reactivity System

Signals

Signalsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4fn ReactivityDemo() -> impl IntoView {
5    // Basic signal
6    let (name, set_name) = create_signal(String::from("World"));
7 
8    // Derived signal (like useMemo)
9    let greeting = create_memo(move || {
10        format!("Hello, {}!", name())
11    });
12 
13    // Effect (runs when dependencies change)
14    create_effect(move || {
15        log::info!("Name changed to: {}", name());
16    });
17 
18    view! {
19        <div>
20            <input
21                type="text"
22                prop:value=name
23                on:input=move |ev| {
24                    set_name(event_target_value(&ev));
25                }
26            />
27            <p>{greeting}</p>
28        </div>
29    }
30}

Stores (Nested State)

TodoApp.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[derive(Clone, Debug)]
4struct Todo {
5    id: u32,
6    text: String,
7    completed: bool,
8}
9 
10#[component]
11fn TodoApp() -> impl IntoView {
12    let (todos, set_todos) = create_store(Vec::<Todo>::new());
13    let (input, set_input) = create_signal(String::new());
14 
15    let add_todo = move |_| {
16        let text = input();
17        if !text.is_empty() {
18            set_todos.update(|todos| {
19                let id = todos.len() as u32 + 1;
20                todos.push(Todo { id, text, completed: false });
21            });
22            set_input(String::new());
23        }
24    };
25 
26    let toggle_todo = move |id: u32| {
27        set_todos.update(|todos| {
28            if let Some(todo) = todos.iter_mut().find(|t| t.id == id) {
29                todo.completed = !todo.completed;
30            }
31        });
32    };
33 
34    view! {
35        <div class="todo-app">
36            <div class="input-row">
37                <input
38                    type="text"
39                    prop:value=input
40                    on:input=move |ev| set_input(event_target_value(&ev))
41                    on:keypress=move |ev| {
42                        if ev.key() == "Enter" {
43                            add_todo(());
44                        }
45                    }
46                />
47                <button on:click=add_todo>"Add"</button>
48            </div>
49 
50            <ul class="todo-list">
51                <For
52                    each=move || todos.get().clone()
53                    key=|todo| todo.id
54                    children=move |todo| {
55                        view! {
56                            <li class:completed=todo.completed>
57                                <input
58                                    type="checkbox"
59                                    prop:checked=todo.completed
60                                    on:change=move |_| toggle_todo(todo.id)
61                                />
62                                <span>{todo.text.clone()}</span>
63                            </li>
64                        }
65                    }
66                />
67            </ul>
68        </div>
69    }
70}

Control Flow

ControlFlow.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4fn ControlFlowDemo() -> impl IntoView {
5    let (show, set_show) = create_signal(true);
6    let (items, _) = create_signal(vec!["Apple", "Banana", "Cherry"]);
7    let (status, set_status) = create_signal("loading");
8 
9    view! {
10        <div>
11            // Conditional rendering
12            <Show
13                when=move || show()
14                fallback=|| view! { <p>"Hidden"</p> }
15            >
16                <p>"Visible"</p>
17            </Show>
18 
19            // List rendering
20            <ul>
21                <For
22                    each=move || items()
23                    key=|item| *item
24                    children=|item| view! {
25                        <li>{item}</li>
26                    }
27                />
28            </ul>
29 
30            // Pattern matching
31            {move || match status() {
32                "loading" => view! { <Spinner /> }.into_view(),
33                "error" => view! { <Error /> }.into_view(),
34                "success" => view! { <Content /> }.into_view(),
35                _ => view! { <p>"Unknown"</p> }.into_view(),
36            }}
37 
38            <button on:click=move |_| set_show.update(|s| *s = !*s)>
39                "Toggle"
40            </button>
41        </div>
42    }
43}

Async Data Fetching

AsyncData.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2use serde::Deserialize;
3 
4#[derive(Clone, Debug, Deserialize)]
5struct User {
6    id: u32,
7    name: String,
8    email: String,
9}
10 
11async fn fetch_user(id: u32) -> Result<User, reqwest::Error> {
12    let url = format!("https://api.example.com/users/{}", id);
13    reqwest::get(&url).await?.json().await
14}
15 
16#[component]
17fn UserProfile(id: u32) -> impl IntoView {
18    let user = create_resource(
19        move || id,
20        |id| async move { fetch_user(id).await }
21    );
22 
23    view! {
24        <Suspense fallback=move || view! { <p>"Loading..."</p> }>
25            {move || user.get().map(|result| match result {
26                Ok(user) => view! {
27                    <div class="profile">
28                        <h2>{&user.name}</h2>
29                        <p>{&user.email}</p>
30                    </div>
31                }.into_view(),
32                Err(e) => view! {
33                    <p class="error">"Error: " {e.to_string()}</p>
34                }.into_view(),
35            })}
36        </Suspense>
37    }
38}

Server Functions

Call server-side Rust functions directly from your components:

ServerFunctions.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2use philjs_server::*;
3 
4// This function runs on the server
5#[server(CreateTodo)]
6pub async fn create_todo(title: String) -> Result<Todo, ServerFnError> {
7    // Access database, environment variables, etc.
8    let todo = db::todos::create(&title).await?;
9    Ok(todo)
10}
11 
12#[component]
13fn TodoForm() -> impl IntoView {
14    let (title, set_title) = create_signal(String::new());
15    let create = create_server_action::<CreateTodo>();
16 
17    view! {
18        <form on:submit=move |ev| {
19            ev.prevent_default();
20            create.dispatch(CreateTodo { title: title() });
21            set_title(String::new());
22        }>
23            <input
24                type="text"
25                prop:value=title
26                on:input=move |ev| set_title(event_target_value(&ev))
27            />
28            <button type="submit" disabled=move || create.pending()>
29                {move || if create.pending() { "Creating..." } else { "Create" }}
30            </button>
31        </form>
32    }
33}

Run Development Server

Terminal
$# Start development server with hot reload
$cargo philjs dev
$
$# Open http://localhost:8080

Build for Production

Terminal
$# Build optimized WASM
$cargo philjs build --release
$
$# Output is in dist/ directory
$ls dist/
